entries.name: DecimalInteger
entries.desc: Decimal integer format, to be converted to Integer.

entries.name: DecimalNumeric
entries.desc:
Decimal integer/float number format, to be converted to Integer for integer
format, Float for float format.

entries.name: OctalInteger
entries.desc:
Ruby/C like octal/hexadecimal/binary integer format, to be converted to
Integer.

entries.name: banner
entries.desc: Heading banner preceding summary.

entries.name: default_argv
entries.desc: Strings to be parsed in default.

entries.name: program_name
entries.desc: Program name to be emitted in error message and default banner, defaults to $0.

entries.name: release
entries.desc: Release code

entries.name: set_banner
entries.desc: Heading banner preceding summary.

entries.name: set_program_name
entries.desc: Program name to be emitted in error message and default banner, defaults to $0.

entries.name: set_summary_indent
entries.desc: Indentation for summary. Must be String (or have + String method).

entries.name: set_summary_width
entries.desc: Width for option list portion of summary. Must be Numeric.

entries.name: summary_indent
entries.desc: Indentation for summary. Must be String (or have + String method).

entries.name: summary_width
entries.desc: Width for option list portion of summary. Must be Numeric.

entries.name: version
entries.desc: Version

entries.name: accept(*args, &blk)
entries.desc: See accept.

entries.name: getopts(*args)
entries.desc: See getopts.

entries.name: inc(arg, default = nil)
entries.desc: Returns an incremented value of default according to arg.

entries.name: new(banner = nil, width = 32, indent = ' ' * 4)
entries.desc: Initializes the instance and yields itself if called with a block.

entries.name: reject(*args, &blk)
entries.desc: See reject.

entries.name: with(*args, &block)
entries.desc: Initializes a new instance and evaluates the optional block in context of the instance. Arguments args are passed to new, see there for description of parameters.

entries.name: accept(*args, &blk)
entries.desc: Directs to accept specified class t. The argument string is passed to the block in which it should be converted to the desired class.

entries.name: additional_message(typ, opt)
entries.desc: Returns additional info.

entries.name: banner()
entries.desc: Heading banner preceding summary.

entries.name: base()
entries.desc: Subject of on_tail.

entries.name: environment(env = File.basename($0, '.*'))
entries.desc: Parses environment variable env or its uppercase with splitting like a shell.

entries.name: getopts(*args)
entries.desc: Wrapper method for getopts.rb.

entries.name: help()
entries.desc: Returns option summary string.

entries.name: load(filename = nil)
entries.desc: Loads options from file names as filename. Does nothing when the file is not present. Returns whether successfully loaded.

entries.name: make_switch(opts, block = nil)
entries.desc: Creates an OptionParser::Switch from the parameters. The parsed argument value is passed to the given block, where it can be processed.

entries.name: new()
entries.desc: Pushes a new List.

entries.name: on(*opts, &block)
entries.desc: Add option switch and handler. See make_switch for an explanation of parameters.

entries.name: on_head(*opts, &block)
entries.desc: Add option switch like with on, but at head of summary.

entries.name: on_tail(*opts, &block)
entries.desc: Add option switch like with on, but at tail of summary.

entries.name: order(*argv, into: nil, &nonopt)
entries.desc: Parses command line arguments argv in order. When a block is given, each non-option argument is yielded. When optional into keyword argument is provided, the parsed option values are stored there via []= method (so it can be Hash, or OpenStruct, or other similar object).

entries.name: order!(argv = default_argv, into: nil, &nonopt)
entries.desc: Same as order, but removes switches destructively. Non-option arguments remain in argv.

entries.name: parse(*argv, into: nil)
entries.desc: Parses command line arguments argv in order when environment variable POSIXLY_CORRECT is set, and in permutation mode otherwise. When optional into keyword argument is provided, the parsed option values are stored there via []= method (so it can be Hash, or OpenStruct, or other similar object).

entries.name: parse!(argv = default_argv, into: nil)
entries.desc: Same as parse, but removes switches destructively. Non-option arguments remain in argv.

entries.name: permute(*argv, into: nil)
entries.desc: Parses command line arguments argv in permutation mode and returns list of non-option arguments. When optional into keyword argument is provided, the parsed option values are stored there via []= method (so it can be Hash, or OpenStruct, or other similar object).

entries.name: permute!(argv = default_argv, into: nil)
entries.desc: Same as permute, but removes switches destructively. Non-option arguments remain in argv.

entries.name: program_name()
entries.desc: Program name to be emitted in error message and default banner, defaults to $0.

entries.name: reject(*args, &blk)
entries.desc: Directs to reject specified class argument.

entries.name: release()
entries.desc: Release code

entries.name: remove()
entries.desc: Removes the last List.

entries.name: separator(string)
entries.desc: Add separator in summary.

entries.name: summarize(to = [], width = @summary_width, max = width - 1, indent = @summary_indent, &blk)
entries.desc: Puts option summary into to and returns to. Yields each line if a block is given.

entries.name: terminate(arg = nil)
entries.desc: Terminates option parsing. Optional parameter arg is a string pushed back to be the first non-option argument.

entries.name: to_a()
entries.desc: Returns option summary list.

entries.name: top()
entries.desc: Subject of on / on_head, accept / reject

entries.name: ver()
entries.desc: Returns version string from #program_name, version and release.

entries.name: version()
entries.desc: Version

entries.name: def_head_option(*opts, &block)
entries.desc: Alias for: define_head

entries.name: def_option(*opts, &block)
entries.desc: Alias for: define

entries.name: def_tail_option(*opts, &block)
entries.desc: Alias for: define_tail

entries.name: to_s()
entries.desc: Alias for: help
